Administration.text:
Type:
Antidote
,
Vasopressors
Routes of Administration: IV

Adult_Dosing.text:
Acquired methemoglobinemia: 1 mg/kg IV over 5-30min, may repeat in 1h with up to 1 mg/kg IV if methemoglobin level still >30% or symptoms persist
Drug-induced methemoglobinemia: 1-2 mg/kg IV slowly over several minutes
See
vasopressors
For hypotension refractory to catecholamine pressors
Consider after catecholamine,
vasopressin
, and mineralocorticoid refractive shock

Special_Populations.text:
Pregnancy Rating
: X, Fetal risk has been demonstrated
Lactation risk
: Infant risk cannot be ruled out
Renal dosing: no adjustment
Hepatic dosing: no adjustment

Contraindications.text:
Allergy to class/drug
G6PD deficiency
ARDS
Pulmonary hypertension

Serious.text:
Hemolytic anemia
Syncope
Serotonin syndrome
Paradoxical
methemoglobinemia
at doses > 4 mg/kg/hr or per bolus
Pulmonary vasoconstriction at 3-4 mg/kg/hr or per bolus

Common.text:
Skin discoloration, urine discoloration, hyperhidrosis
Nausea, abnormal taste
Limb pain
Dizziness, headache

Serious.text:
Hemolytic anemia
Syncope
Serotonin syndrome
Paradoxical
methemoglobinemia
at doses > 4 mg/kg/hr or per bolus
Pulmonary vasoconstriction at 3-4 mg/kg/hr or per bolus

Skin discoloration, urine discoloration, hyperhidrosis

Skin discoloration, urine discoloration, hyperhidrosis
Nausea, abnormal taste
Limb pain
Dizziness, headache

Pharmacology.text:
Half-life: 24h
Metabolism: Hepatic
Excretion: Mostly renal

Mechanism_of_Action.text:
Promotes non-enzymatic redox conversion of methemoglobin to hemoglobin
Improves vascular tone via inhibition of nitric oxide synthase
